rev.diff:
Line 300: Line 300:
Banks temporarily reopened throughout the country amidst long queues,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/02/06/us-egypt-banks-idUSTRE7150EZ20110206 |title=Customers queue at Egypt banks after protests |publisher=Reuters |date=6 February 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref> and people rushed to buy US dollars.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-pound-down-less-feared-central-bank-supports |title=Egypt pound down less than feared, central bank supports |work=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=6 February 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref>
Banks temporarily reopened throughout the country amidst long queues,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/02/06/us-egypt-banks-idUSTRE7150EZ20110206 |title=Customers queue at Egypt banks after protests |publisher=Reuters |date=6 February 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref> and people rushed to buy US dollars.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/egypt-pound-down-less-feared-central-bank-supports |title=Egypt pound down less than feared, central bank supports |work=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=6 February 2011 |accessdate=6 February 2011}}</ref>
â
There were also negotiations between Vice President [[Omar Suleiman]] and members from the opposition, including [[Mohammed Morsi]] and [[Sayed el Badawi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12307698 |title=BBC News - Egypt unrest |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> Suleiman agreed to a plan to set up a committee of judiciary and political figures to study constitutional reforms. Results of the committee are due by early March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110206/D9L7B7IO0.html |title=Egypt's regime makes new concessions to opposition |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> Naguib Sawiris, who was also involved in the talks, said that "big progress" had been made.<Ref>http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-07/egyptian-credit-risk-falling-to-lowest-since-protests-started.html</ref>
+
There were also negotiations between Vice President [[Omar Suleiman]] and members from the opposition, including {{link-interwiki|en=Mohammed Morsi|lang=ar|lang_title=ÙØ­ÙØ¯ ÙØ±Ø³Ù}} and [[El-Sayyid el-Badawi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-12307698 |title=BBC News - Egypt unrest |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> Suleiman agreed to a plan to set up a committee of judiciary and political figures to study constitutional reforms. Results of the committee are due by early March.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110206/D9L7B7IO0.html |title=Egypt's regime makes new concessions to opposition |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> Naguib Sawiris, who was also involved in the talks, said that "big progress" had been made.<Ref>http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-07/egyptian-credit-risk-falling-to-lowest-since-protests-started.html</ref>
